newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Sino-British group to hold talks on Hong Kong.
newsitem.headline: Sino-British group to hold talks on Hong Kong.

text.p: China and Britain will hold talks in Beijing next week on arrangements for Hong Kong's 1997 reversion to Chinese sovereignty, the Hong Kong government said on Tuesday.
The Sino-British Joint Liaison Group (JLG), which is hammering out details of the handover, will meet on September 17 to 19 in its 37th round of talks.
The British team will be led by senior diplomat Hugh Davies.
With fewer than 300 days left before the change in sovereignty, the JLG is expected to discuss plans for the handover ceremony and endorse a long-delayed plan to expand Hong Kong's container port.
